name: National Geographic Maps Map
summary: Learn about .@EX files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Topics Entertainment National Geographic Maps is an 8-CD set that allows users to view maps published throughout National Geographic's history. Each map also includes interactive extras, such as associated photos, videos, or audio. National Geographic Maps was available for Windows 95 and 98.
The maps that National Geographic Maps uses are saved as @EX files. Each @EX file includes the following header:
Each @EX file also includes multiple JFIF segments, which are used to show a map to a user at various zoom levels and resolutions.

instructions: You can open @EX files in Topics Entertainment National Geographic Maps (Windows). However, Maps can run on only Windows 95 and Windows 98.
If you want to view the map images an @EX file contains outside National Geographic Maps, you can do so by printing the file using a virtual PDF printer, such as PDFCreator (Windows).
